Package hippodrome

Class ControlCentre

  • java.lang.Object
    • hippodrome.ControlCentre

  • public class ControlCentre
extends java.lang.Object
    Place where the Spectators go to enjoy the race (at a Watching Stand) and the Broker controls the races and publishes its results.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Hugo Fragata, Rui Lopes

      Verification of bet's winners.
      static void entertainTheGuests​()
      Start entertaining the guests (representation of the Spectators), as the Broker's actions can be considered as terminated.

      Signal given by the last Spectator which arrives at the Paddock to watch the horses, before placing a bet.

      Signal set out to all the Spectators in order to watch the Race number raceNumber.

      Signal given by the last pair Horse/Jockey which exits the Stable in direction to the Paddock.

      Relax a bit from the games, as this is could be the final transition of a Spectator lifecycle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ControlCentre

        public ControlCentre​()

    • Method Detail

      • summonHorsesToPaddock

        public static void summonHorsesToPaddock​(int raceNumber)
        Signal given by the Broker to summon all the horses from the Stable to the Paddock. Such horses, representation of pairs Horse/Jockey's, must be identified by a race number identification, such as the Broker's call should only be relative to some of the pairs - the ones which will run side-by-side on the same Race, on the same RacingTrack.
        Parameters:
        raceNumber - number identification of the next Race.

      • startTheRace

        public static void startTheRace​(int raceNumber)
        Signal given by the Broker to start a Race identified by raceNumber.
        Parameters:
        raceNumber - number idenitification of the next Race to be started as of this instant.

      • entertainTheGuests

        public static void entertainTheGuests​()
        Start entertaining the guests (representation of the Spectators), as the Broker's actions can be considered as terminated.

      • waitForTheNextRace

        public static boolean waitForTheNextRace​(int raceNumber)
        Wait for the next signal of the Broker in order to prepare a new Race, identified by the number raceNumber.
        Parameters:
        raceNumber - number identification of the next Race to begin.
        Returns:
        true if the next race is still not prepared to begin; otherwise false.

      • goWatchTheRace

        public static void goWatchTheRace​(int raceNumber)
        Signal set out to all the Spectators in order to watch the Race number raceNumber.
        Parameters:
        raceNumber - number identification of the Race which is about to start.

      • haveIWon

        public static boolean haveIWon​(Spectator spectator)
        Verification if a given spectator has won his (or hers) bet.
        Parameters:
        spectator - Spectator who has placed a bet earlier and wants to verify if it did win indeed or not.
        Returns:
        true if spectator has won his (or hers) bet; otherwise, it will return false.

      • relaxABit

        public static void relaxABit​()
        Relax a bit from the games, as this is could be the final transition of a Spectator lifecycle.

      • reportResults

        public static void reportResults​()
        Publishing of the results by the Broker performing its job.

      • areThereAnyWinners

        public static boolean areThereAnyWinners​()
        Verification of bet's winners.
        Returns:
        true if anybody had won indeed; otherwise it will return false.

      • summonHorsesToPaddock

        public static void summonHorsesToPaddock​()
        Signal given by the Broker to summon all the horses from the Stable to the Paddock.

      • proceedToPaddock

        public static void proceedToPaddock​()
        Signal given by the last pair Horse/Jockey which exits the Stable in direction to the Paddock.

      • goCheckHorses

        public static void goCheckHorses​()
        Signal given by the last Spectator which arrives at the Paddock to watch the horses, before placing a bet.
